results.title: Born to build
results.brief_description: Bodybuilding is more than just moving heavy metal. To Alex it is his life. Fascinated as a child with size and strength and an addiction to Marvel comics Alex finally starting pumping iron at the age of 16 and became hooked. Follow his journey in this humourous comic book style presentation as he lifts those weights and pumps that iron to build the perfect body.

group.title: Western stories: expressions for the future. [Vol. 1]

results.title: The Art of rhyme
results.brief_description:
Ever since a child Mykel has had a fascination for the art of rhyme and a respect for the artistic and creative use of the english language. In this animated piece, he speaks of his dedication to perfecting his art through rap and hip-hop where constant rhyme is no longer a restriction and each syllable and phrase flows into a harmonious melody. “Allowing your mind to be blown away, storming the front of your imagination and pushing it to the limit - that’s the buzz!”
Music by Pabstrakt.

results.title: Billycarts
results.brief_description: This evocative silent home movie footage shows kids playing in a billycart in the drive-way and on the street, and creates a strong nostalgia for long ago youth. Athol Adams footage is courtesy of Jenny and Owen Peake.

results.title: The Little Frenchman
results.brief_description: Roger was a widower with no living relatives or close friends. His life experiences placed him in both world wars and post war migration. This is his story.

results.title: Training for the last run
results.brief_description: Commonwealth gold medallist Raelene Boyle faced her toughest challenge in the fight against breast cancer. ‘My breast cancer diagnosis in 1996 did see me race again. This time it was a race to survive’. Created in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop ‘Journeys with Breast Cancer’ in association with Breast Cancer Network Australia.

group_siblings.title: To my dearest beloved one - Shewitey Mearey

results.title: To my dearest beloved one - Shewitey Mearey
results.brief_description: A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop “Journeys with Breast Cancer” Created in association with Breast Cancer Network Australia. “I said to the doctor, I don’t care if I die tomorrow but I don’t want to leave my daughter alone. He said to me that first I had to live before I could have another child.”

group_siblings.title: Little Claude - a'hunting he will go

results.title: Olympic Games, Melbourne, Australia, 1956
results.brief_description: The 1956 Olympics warranted the Straford Brothers using their cherished stock of coloured film to capture this unique event. Original footage of the Athletics field (notably pole vaulting), swimming and diving events in the pool have been compiled by Frank years later with additional video content and a voiceover. Despite shooting some of this additional footage on his living room floor (inadvertantly including a glimpse of shagpile carpet) and such ‘special effects’ as a whiteboard marker illustrating points on a map, the documentary has a lot of interesting detail about the event; about their personal experience of it and the novelty of seeing OB Television crews in action.

results.title: World to conquer
results.brief_description: This sci-fi ‘Straford Brothers Specialite’ is a scripted drama featuring local student actors. A classic sci-fi set up, it has some nifty DIY special effects including painstakingly made miniature sets (watch out for the alien control room!), animated spaceship and a alien periscope very reminiscent of early ‘Doctor Who’ episodes.
